thread.title: Grub crawls out of Coles Finest sausage as Sydney man cooks it
thread.title_full: Grub crawls out of Coles Finest sausage as Sydney man cooks it

author: Heath Aston
title: Grub crawls out of Coles Finest sausage as Sydney man cooks it
text:
The grub crawled out of the sausage as it was being cooked. Photo: Supplied 
"I had a bread roll in one hand and I was ready for lunch when I saw this worm thing come out of one of the sausages. It didn't like the heat and it was squirming everywhere trying to get away," he said. 
A DIY autopsy on the grub revealed a belly full of smaller maggots, according to Mr Wood. Advertisement 
"I was looking forward to lunch but that really ruined my appetite, it was just sickening," he said. 
A Coles spokeswoman said she could not comment until she checked the facts with the Lindfield store. 
It is not the first time that a customer has blown the whistle on nasties in Coles' small goods. 
In November, a Perth mother of six posted a complaint on social media that her Coles cocktail frankfurters were crawling with live maggots - something she said she discovered shortly after feeding them to her kids. 
At the time, Coles said its quality team suspected the common housefly larvae had infected the franks but that most likely occurred after they were cooked at home. 
Two months earlier, another woman posted a video of maggots on a cooked chicken which she bought from a Coles store in Rockingham south of Perth. 
"Just picked up a hot chicken for lunch, and it's got things crawling on it," she wrote. "Thanks Coles". Advertisement
